articles.summary: While the government did not accept the Opposition's demand for an urgent Parliament session after the Pahalgam terror attack, the discussions on it and Operation Sindoor remained a highlight of 2025. Take a look at key bills that made the Parliament roar with heated debates.

articles.title: Winter Session 2025: Parliament clocks record productivity as reforms dominate agenda
articles.summary: From sweeping changes in rural employment and labour laws to liberalised FDI norms in insurance and nuclear energy, Parliament’s Winter Session reflected the government’s intent to fast-track structural reforms, even as several measures triggered sharp political and policy pushback.

articles.title: MeitY issues formal notice to X over Grok's  IT Act lapses
articles.summary: MeitY has issued a formal notice to X, citing serious lapses in statutory due diligence under the IT Act and Rules. The government is concerned about X's AI tool, Grok, generating and circulating obscene content, particularly targeting women and children. X has been directed to review Grok's framework, remove unlawful content, and take action against offending users within 72 hours.

articles.summary: From February 1, pan masala, cigarettes, tobacco and similar products will attract a GST rate of 40%, while biris will attract 18% Goods and Services Tax (GST), according to a government notification

articles.summary: The central government has approved 22 new projects under the Electronics Component Manufacturing Scheme (ECMS), clearing investments worth INR 41,863…

articles.title: 2025 was a busy trade year for India. King of Tariffs strain, FTA with New Zealand, UK & Oman deals
articles.summary: The year began with two major trade announcements—opening of negotiations for “first tranche” of a bilateral trade agreement with the US following PM Modi’s visit to Washington.

articles.title: Grok user making illegal content will suffer same consequence as uploading such content: Musk
articles.summary: Microblogging platform X owner Elon Musk declared users of its AI service Grok generating illegal content will face severe penalties. This follows a directive from India's Ministry of Electronics and IT demanding immediate removal of vulgar and unlawful material.

articles.title: CBDT Chairman Ravi Agrawal asks officials to be ready for transition to new I-T Act
articles.summary: The Income Tax Department is gearing up for a significant change. A new direct tax law will be implemented from April 1, 2026, replacing the old Act. CBDT Chairman Ravi Agrawal has urged officials to be ready and understand the new rules. Training and capacity building are underway to ensure a smooth transition.

articles.title: Niti Aayog drafts plan to shield senior citizens from digital scams
articles.summary: India is preparing a policy road map to protect senior citizens from digital scams, with Niti Aayog working on a multi-ministerial action plan. The plan will focus on digital literacy, stronger security and coordinated monitoring as cases of ‘digital arrest’ fraud rise. The move will form part of broader elderly care measures, with details likely in Budget 2026-27.

articles.title: Social media should take responsibility of content they publish: Union minister Vaishnaw
articles.summary: Social media companies must be accountable for the content they host, Union minister Ashwini Vaishnaw has emphasised. The Indian government is pushing for stricter laws to ensure this. Online platforms have been warned of legal action if they fail to remove obscene and unlawful material. This includes content generated by AI apps.

articles.title: ‘The doorbell is not the problem’: Why government regulation is necessary for the gig work sector
articles.summary: Zomato CEO Deepinder Goyal’s defence of his company’s economic model collapses under its own contradictions.

articles.title: 'Khelega India!': Sports, fitness may soon be part of skills training
articles.summary: India is integrating sports and fitness into its skill training programs, aiming to enhance trainees' physical resilience and provide a potential second income. This initiative, inspired by Prime Minister Modi's vision, will include mandatory yoga and self-defense training at skill institutes, with certification opportunities. The government also plans to develop sports infrastructure on campus, tailored to regional strengths.

articles.title: Govt. notifies February 1 as the end of GST compensation cess, start of new tobacco tax regime
articles.summary: In a series of notifications on New Year’s Day, the Finance Ministry announced the end of GST compensation cess, the increase in the excise duty on tobacco products, and the new GST rates on these items as well

During the two-day visit on January 8-9, Goyal will meet the Executive Vice-President and European Commissioner for […]

articles.summary: The government has demanded that X undertake a comprehensive and immediate technical review of Grok including how it processes prompts and creation capabilities so as to not facilitate sexually explicit, unlawful content.

articles.title: MeitY takes cognisance of Grok misuse on X, action to follow soon: Secretary S Krishnan
articles.summary: The electronics and IT ministry has begun examining the alleged misuse of X’s AI tool Grok to generate obscene and non-consensual images, with MeitY Secretary S Krishnan indicating that regulatory action could be taken swiftly as scrutiny intensifies around platform accountability and AI safety.

articles.title: Why HC registry refused to delete names of Akshay Kumar, PVR & INOX from Bata’s Jolly LLB 2 suit
articles.summary: In 2017 defamation lawsuit, Bata took offence to Jolly LLB 2 trailer scene where Annu Kapoor's character sneered at Akshay Kumar's character by referring to his ‘Bata footwear’.

articles.title: India mulls tax exemption for sovereign wealth funds’ equity gains amid heavy foreign outflows
articles.summary: India may exempt Sovereign Wealth Funds and patient capital from taxes on Indian stock market earnings. This proposal aims to attract stable foreign investment following significant sell-offs by foreign fund managers. The government is examining extending these benefits to other long-term investors like pension funds. Such a move could boost capital inflows into the Indian equity market.

articles.title: India-UK trade pact expected to come into force by first half of 2026: British envoy
articles.summary: A major trade deal between India and the United Kingdom is set for implementation in early 2026. This agreement aims to significantly boost trade between the two nations. Indian exporters will gain duty-free access to the UK market for most products.

articles.title: The Tencent-Flipkart test: Is New Delhi about to ease up on Chinese investment?
articles.summary: The government is weighing a proposal to exempt investments up to 26% from the rigorous security screening process mandated by PN(3), provided the foreign entity exercises no management control and holds no seat on the company’s board, two people familiar with the matter said.

articles.title: A year of insurance reforms in India, yet more ground to cover
articles.summary: Over the past year, India has rewritten key rules governing insurance. Yet for policyholders, the real test lies not in regulation, but in how these changes play out when a claim is filed.

articles.title: India-US trade talks, Trump and the China factor: Why New Delhi’s foreign policy faces its toughest test in 2026
articles.summary: As geopolitical fault lines deepen, former Indian diplomats warn that stalled trade talks with Washington reflect a broader strategic shift, forcing New Delhi to rethink how it balances the US, China and its own economic interests in a volatile global environment.

articles.title: Born in a lab, Indian Statistical Institute helped shape new India. A bill intends to alter its future
articles.summary: Section of faculty, students and alumni oppose MoSPI's draft Bill that seeks to replace Indian Statistical Institute's elected Governing Council with government-nominated board.

articles.title: Email ID ‘abc@gmail’, ‘111111’ as bank A/C—CAG flags gaps in Modi govt’s flagship upskilling scheme
articles.summary: Audit finds violations in age and education criteria, duplicate photos, unspent funds, and shut training centres in states surveyed; report tabled in Parliament.

articles.title: House panel calls for pen-&-paper exams by NTA after ‘leaks’, NAAC internal probe amid bribery case
articles.summary: Computer-based tests, if used, should be conducted only in government-controlled centres, a Digvijay Singh-led Standing Committee has said in Parliament.

articles.title: With MGNREGA agitation, Cong eyes long-term drive
articles.summary: Congress plans a long-term sensitization campaign for MGNREGA workers, drawing inspiration from the farm laws stir. Unlike the farmer protests, the current agitation faces challenges mobilizing the poor working class for prolonged struggle. The party aims to educate workers about potential impacts of new policies, acknowledging the battle will be prolonged.

articles.title: AYUSH gets recognition in India's free trade pacts with Oman, New Zealand
articles.summary: India's traditional medicine system, AYUSH, has achieved formal recognition in bilateral trade agreements with Oman and New Zealand. These agreements, finalized last December, include dedicated sections for health services and traditional medicine. AYUSH and herbal product exports saw a growth of 6.11 percent, reaching USD 688.89 million in 2024-25 from USD 649.2 million in 2023-24.

articles.title: Government announces Rs 7,295-cr export package to improve exporters' access to credit
articles.summary: The government has unveiled a Rs 7,295-crore export support package, including a Rs 5,181-crore interest subvention scheme and Rs 2,114-crore collateral support, to enhance exporters' access to credit. These initiatives, spanning 2025-31, aim to address trade finance challenges, offering subsidies and guarantees to eligible MSMEs, particularly for defence and SCOMET products.

articles.title: PM Modi reviews progress on overseas critical mineral acquisitions, ₹1,500-crore recycling incentive scheme
articles.summary: The review covered India’s efforts to secure long-term access to key minerals such as lithium, cobalt and rare earths, while scaling up domestic recycling capacity to reduce import dependence and support manufacturing under the Make in India programme.

articles.title: SIR lens on parents of Goans with Portuguese passports
articles.summary: Around 30,000 Goans surrendered Indian passports in a decade for foreign nationality, primarily Portuguese. Now, their parents, who registered births in Portugal, face scrutiny from the Election Commission. This action aims to verify electoral roll entries of individuals who acquired foreign passports and citizenship.

articles.title: Cong stir bid to ensure NREGA corruption continues: Shivraj Singh Chouhan; claims G Ram G is graft-free & tech-driven
articles.summary: Rural Development Minister Shivraj Singh Chouhan has labeled Congress's 'MGNREGA Bachao Sangram' as 'Bhrashtachaar Bachao Sangram,' accusing the opposition of spreading misinformation about the new 'Viksit Bharat- Guarantee for Rozgar and Ajeevika Mission (Gramin) Act.

articles.title: Stamp duty waived on farm loans up to Rs 2 lakh in Maharashtra
articles.summary: The revenue and forest department issued a government gazette notification in this regard on January 1. The waiver has come into effect from that date.

articles.title: Labour Codes may spur hiring as firms get more flexibility to restructure
articles.summary: The new Labour Codes are expected to boost hiring by giving firms greater flexibility to restructure operations. The Industrial Relations Code raises the threshold for government approval for layoffs and closures to 300 workers from 100, easing compliance for MSMEs and mid-sized firms. Experts say labour-intensive sectors will benefit most, though some warn of higher labour turnover and income volatility.

articles.title: ICICI Bank, SBI among 10 largecap bets by Antique Broking for 2026 as it eyes an earnings rebound
articles.summary: The brokerage sees India’s “Goldilocks” phase continuing, supported by policy actions, easing macro headwinds, and a revival in capital expenditure, while preferring financials, capex-linked sectors, defence, and select discretionary stocks.

articles.title: Why Deepak Shenoy remains cautious on tobacco, QSR valuations
articles.summary: Deepak Shenoy of Capitalmind MF outlines investment strategies amidst market shifts, advocating for conglomerate demergers and diversification for tobacco firms. He notes QSR valuations are stretched but sees potential in electronics manufacturing and power distribution, with PSU banks expected to lead financials and autos benefiting from policy support.

articles.title: Triple policy boosters set stage for a stronger market year ahead: Ajay Bagga
articles.summary: Indian markets are set for a robust year. Experts foresee renewed economic momentum fueled by government support. Expect double-digit nominal GDP growth translating to strong earnings. Financials are expected to lead the rally, with autos and technology also showing promise. Government spending on infrastructure, railways, and defence will be key drivers.

articles.title: India launches anti-dumping probe into nylon-6 chip imports from China, Russia
articles.summary: India has started an anti-dumping probe into nylon-6 chips from China and Russia, prompted by domestic manufacturers' concerns over cheap imports affecting local industry. The investigation will evaluate the implications for pricing and market stability in the synthetic raw materials sector.

articles.title: RBI continues to build forex reserves which rose to $696 billion
articles.summary: India’s forex reserves rose by $3.3 billion to $696.61 billion in the week ended December 26, RBI data showed. The increase was led by a sharp $2.95 billion jump in gold holdings and a modest rise in foreign currency assets. Reserves remain near record highs, providing cover for 9–10 months of imports amid global volatility.

articles.title: Centre designates core customs and indirect tax digital platforms as “critical information infrastructure” under IT Act
articles.summary: The Indian government has designated core customs and indirect tax digital platforms, including ICEGATE, ECCS, and ACES-GST, as "critical information infrastructure." This move significantly enhances cybersecurity controls and restricts access to authorized personnel only. Unauthorized access to these protected systems now carries criminal penalties under the Information Technology Act.

articles.title: BJP ally, Christian groups flag concern about violence against community during Christmas season
articles.summary: The National People’s Party said it will urge the Meghalaya government to write to the states concerned seeking action to prevent such attacks.

articles.title: What the US invasion of Venezuela reveals about international law
articles.summary: If corruption, repression or even crimes against humanity justify external military action, no leader is safe and no border is meaningful.

articles.title: Top updates: Venezuelan president lands in New York after being ‘captured’ by US military
articles.summary: The Venezuelan government has described the US government’s actions as ‘military aggression’ and has called for him to be immediately released.

articles.summary: H Vinoth’s Tamil movie also stars Pooja Hegde, Bobby Deol, Priyamani, Mamitha Baiju and Gautham Menon. Scheduled for a January 9 release.

Both measures will be rolled out over a period of six years (2025-31). Additional Secretary in the Commerce Ministry […]

articles.title: No plan to change land acquisition policy, says cabinet secretary T V Somanathan
articles.summary: Officials said the PRAGATI platform has helped unlock stalled investments by resolving issues linked to land, environment and right of way, enabling large road, rail and power projects to move forward despite persistent structural challenges.

articles.title: Finding growth without overpaying is the real task now, says Axis MF's Shreyash Devalkar
articles.summary: Axis Mutual Fund’s Shreyash Devalkar said Indian equities are facing valuation pressure as most investment themes are already priced in. He is focusing on growth continuity and GARP opportunities, especially in potential turnaround sectors such as banks, lending, and parts of autos. He highlighted risks in high-valuation sectors, evolving consumption patterns in QSRs, and said inflation and policy cues will be key factors to track going ahead.

articles.title: India keeps small savings interest rates unchanged for seventh straight quarter
articles.summary: The government keeps interest rates unchanged for PPF, NSC, and other small savings schemes for the seventh straight quarter starting January 1, 2026. Sukanya Samriddhi Scheme offers 8.2%.

articles.title: 1 regulator, 3 councils: Inside Viksit Bharat Shiksha Adhishthan Bill for higher education overhaul
articles.summary: Modi govt is set to introduce bill that proposes umbrella body for higher education, councils for regulation, accreditation. It will be headed by a chairperson appointed by the President.

articles.title: NHAI flags 424 'telecom black spots', urges TRAI to step in
articles.summary: NHAI has identified 424 "telecom black spots" totaling 1,750 km on highways and expressways, urging TRAI to direct operators to improve mobile network coverage. This lack of connectivity hinders emergency communication and highway operations. NHAI also proposed free, proactive SMS alerts for accident-prone zones, including those with stray cattle, to enhance road user safety.

articles.title: Confusion, queues, goof-ups mark 2 months of SIR in Bengal
articles.summary: Two months into Bengal's electoral roll revision, citizens face confusion and difficulties regaining their voting rights due to document discrepancies and unclear directives. Chief Minister Mamata Banerjee has criticized the "unplanned, arbitrary" process, highlighting instances of elderly and infirm voters being summoned for hearings, leading to widespread public outcry.

articles.title: ‘International law cannot be violated’: India's main oppn Congress on US operation in Venezuela
articles.summary: The Congress reaction came soon after India voiced “deep concern” over the attacks on Venezuela and the capture of its President by American forces.

articles.title: Make in India: Why sum of parts is bigger than the whole
articles.summary: The Electronics Components Manufacturing Scheme (ECMS) is bolstering domestic production of critical parts, moving beyond mere assembly. With the recent approval of its third tranche, ECMS is fostering a comprehensive electronics ecosystem, aiming to significantly increase local value addition and strengthen supply chain resilience.

articles.title: Govt proposes 90-day work requirement for gig workers to get social security
articles.summary: In a significant move, gig and platform workers will soon be required to log a minimum number of working days to qualify for social security benefits. Proposed regulations indicate a threshold of 90 days with a single aggregator or 120 days across various platforms each year. This initiative is designed to integrate workers into essential programs like Ayushman Bharat.

articles.title: Sebi developing AI-driven tool to analyse cyber safety at entities
articles.summary: Sebi chairman Tuhin Kanta Pandey revealed that the markets regulator is spearheading the development of an innovative AI tool designed to assess the cyber safety of regulated entities. A dedicated working group will also focus on crafting a comprehensive technology roadmap for market infrastructure institutions, laying out a strategic vision for the next five and ten years.

articles.title: India’s fiscal fault lines between Centre and states return to the spotlight
articles.summary: Recent changes to India's rural job guarantee scheme have brought back into the spotlight long-running disputes between the Union government and states on how financial resources should be shared.

articles.title: Govt keeps small savings interest rates unchanged for the March quarter

articles.summary: Chief Minister A Revanth Reddy said that the new Viksit Bharat-Guarantee for Rozgar and Ajeevika Mission (Gramin) Act was detrimental to the poor.

articles.summary: The interaction with booth-level officers comes as the Election Commission prepares for a state-wide Special Intensive Revision of electoral rolls, a process that hinges on extensive house-to-house verification and accurate voter data collection at the grassroots level.

articles.title: Muscle tissue damage, hormone imbalances: Hard workouts can lead to overtraining syndrome
articles.summary: Stressing the body repeatedly without sufficient rest and recovery can flip progress. It can also leave you more susceptible to stress fractures, chronic tendonitis and other overuse injuries.

articles.title: India’s AI Leap: Why application lifecycle management platforms will define enterprise success
articles.summary: Unlike traditional applications, agentic systems must monitor themselves in production, adapt to dynamic data and user behaviour, operate within strict compliance constraints, and be explainable to business users and regulators. However, most platforms are not designed to support this.

articles.title: Social media should take responsibility for the content they publish: Ashwini Vaishnaw
articles.summary: The Centre has earlier this week warned online platforms—mainly social media firms—of legal consequences if they fail to act on obscene, vulgar, pornographic, paedophilic, and other forms of unlawful content.

articles.title: New Year’s Eve UPI payments hit Rs 1.1 lakh Cr as online card spend dips
articles.summary: UPI transactions surged 17.02% to Rs 1.12 lakh crore on December 31, according to RBI's payments settlement data, up from Rs 93,147.85 crore on NYE last year.

articles.title: GST, cess levy together to help detect evasion in pan masala sector: Sources
articles.summary: Finance Ministry introduces health and national security cess on pan masala manufacturing with 40 percent GST, creating a dual tax system to curb evasion and protect revenue from February 1.

articles.title: Tobacco industry body flags risks of steep excise duty hike, urges policy review
articles.summary: The Tobacco Institute of India warns that the sharp excise duty hike could harm farmers, MSMEs, and boost illicit trade, urging the government to reconsider its decision.

articles.summary: The other firms to receive regulatory nod are Shriram Food Industry, Vadodara-based Tempsens Instruments (India) Ltd, Indira IVF and Rays Of Belief Ltd.

articles.title: UPI volumes, value touch all-time highs in December
articles.summary: UPI hit a record 21.63 billion transactions worth ₹27.97 lakh crore in December 2025, as per NPCI.

articles.summary: Letter of intent for Typhoon jets marks strategic shift amid budget constraints, quality concerns over Chinese equipment and geopolitical balancing act.

articles.summary: In 2025, SC dealt with sanctity of verdicts, made bail rule rather than exception, addressed delays in passage of Bills and took suo motu cognisance of ecological concerns over mining in Aravallis.

articles.title: Centre pre-publishes draft rules on four labour codes to seek stakeholders' feedback

articles.title: Deepinder Goyal recalls Zomato's reluctant push into food delivery
articles.summary: Goyal explained that Swiggy started last-mile logistics in India’s food delivery sector, a move he dismissed for years as economically unviable. “Swiggy started last-mile logistics in food delivery. For a couple of years, I was resisting it, thinking this model can never make money, because the economics were off,” he said. Customer enthusiasm ultimately made the decision for him, leaving Zomato with little option but to adapt, Goyal said, speaking on the Raj Shamani podcast.

articles.title: UP ‘Shri Anna’ farmer show strong preference for govt procurement over open market sales

This year, a total of 2.13 lakh metric tonnes of millet, 43,562 metric tonnes of sorghum, and 12,208 metric tonnes of maize were procured across the state. Millet procurement was carried out in 33 districts, maize in 25 districts, and sorghum in 11 districts.

articles.title: India becomes world's largest rice producer, surpasses China: Agriculture Minister Shivraj Singh Chouhan

Union Agriculture Minister Shivraj Singh Chouhan released 184 new high-yielding seed varieties for 25 crops. These advancements aim to boost crop production and increase farmer income, ensuring India's food security and global food supply.

articles.title: Tax hike raises risk of smuggling of tobacco products and revenue loss for govt: Experts

The new excise duty structure, combined with existing GST, represents a 60-70% increase, potentially driving consumers towards smuggled products. This move risks amplifying India's already substantial illicit tobacco market.

articles.title: Decade-old income tax demands resurface on portal, leaving taxpayers scrambling for proof

articles.title: Gold, silver enter 2026 on cautious note after historic gains in 2025
articles.summary: Gold and silver began 2026 subdued in India after strong 2025 gains; experts expect consolidation but see long-term support from demand and global cues.

articles.title: In UP, SIR draft roll sets off alarm bells in BJP. Focus now on adding new voters in urban strongholds
articles.summary: Provisional data accessed by thePrint shows 18.7% of electorate could be struck off from rolls. Lucknow recorded highest voter deletions, followed by Ghaziabad, Kanpur, Meerut and Prayagraj.

articles.title: ‘BJP ignored us’: Ally Athawale unhappy with NDA’s seat-sharing ahead of BMC polls
articles.summary: The Republican Party of India (Athawale) chief added that BJP and Shiv Sena's alliance has created trouble for his party, claiming that RPI was not even included in seat-sharing talks.

articles.title: Akali Dal turns Mann’s ‘dinosaur’ jibe into comeback campaign. Punjab politics takes ‘Jurassic Park’ turn
articles.summary: From lizards, to dinosaurs crushing brooms with their feet, AAP & SAD have turned barbs into a memefest with AI images packed with political messaging.

articles.title: For Andhra Pradesh’s all-season IAS Praveen Prakash, Naidu-Jagan rivalry cost him his career
articles.summary: Prakash took VRS in 2024 after he found himself without a posting in Naidu govt. He says he was also denied central deputation, reflecting on politicisation of Indian bureaucracy.

articles.title: Under fire over shanty demolitions, Karnataka CM Siddaramaiah gets support from unlikely quarter—BJP
articles.summary: Row after Kerala CM, Congress high command express displeasure over demolition of 150 shanties in Bengaluru.

articles.title: Rahul aide’s Tamil Nadu-UP debt data pits Congress against Congress. TN-party chief writes to AICC
articles.summary: A social media post that compared Tamil Nadu finances unfavourably with UP has snowballed into an internal Congress row with TNCC accusing Praveen Chakravarty of boosting BJP narrative.

articles.title: DRDO successfully conducts salvo launch of 2 ‘Pralay’ missiles off Odisha coast
articles.summary: Successful completion of the salvo launch has established the reliability of the missile, said Defence Minister Rajnath Singh while commending the move.

articles.title: China says it mediated end to India-Pakistan conflict, even as Islamabad used Chinese weaponry in May
articles.summary: Chinese foreign minister claimed Beijing was involved in mediating end to a number of conflicts in 2025. Over 81% of all Pakistani military hardware imported in last 5 years came from China.

articles.title: Stake in PIA to UAE deal, Fauji Foundation—the money machine that keeps Pakistan Army running
articles.summary: Fauji Foundation is part of Pakistan’s broader military–corporate complex, where armed forces control significant economic assets to extend influence beyond defence and into the economy.

articles.title: In Dhaka for Khaleda Zia’s funeral, Jaishankar meets Tarique Rahman and Pakistan Assembly speaker
articles.summary: Jaishankar’s visit to Dhaka was his first since ouster of former PM Hasina in August 2024. Ties between India, Bangladesh have been tense following assassination of Sharif Osman Hadi.

articles.title: ‘Brothers’ UAE, Saudi back rival forces in Yemen. In latest flashpoint, glimpse of deepening faultlines
articles.summary: UAE announced withdrawal of remaining forces in Yemen after Saudi's limited strike at Al-Mukalla. Riyadh accused Abu Dhabi of moving military equipment to support separatist STC in Yemen.

articles.title: Begums of Bangladesh: When rivals Khaleda Zia & Sheikh Hasina joined hands to topple dictatorship
articles.summary: Their much talked about brief alliance, despite differences, helped end nearly a decade of dictatorship under General Hussain Muhammad Ershad.

articles.title: Barbados to Sri Lanka, countries that bestowed honours on PM Modi in 2025
articles.summary: The year began with the ‘Order of Freedom of Barbados’—the highest civilian order given to a foreign dignitary—conferred on the PM in March.

articles.title: Case of the missing police canine & the Haryana head constable who fought 25 yrs to clear his name
articles.summary: It all began on the night of 19-20 June in the year 2000. Laika, a service canine with the CID Unit’s Dog Squad in Haryana’s Hisar, managed to slip out of her kennel.

articles.title: Why HC ruled in favour of appointing arbitrator to resolve IPL franchisee’s shareholders’ dispute
articles.summary: The main dispute between the shareholders centred on a company resolution regarding the rotational appointment of the chairman.

articles.title: ‘Does 100m-height criterion reduce green cover?’ Why SC put in abeyance its order on Aravallis definition
articles.summary: A vacation bench led by CJI Surya Kant said public dissent and criticism about the November order stemmed from perceived ambiguity and lack of clarity on the issue.

articles.title: Heavy screen time for young children ‘altered brain networks’, linked to teen anxiety, research finds
articles.summary: The study, published in The Lancet’s eBioMedicine open access journal, tracked 168 children for more than a decade and conducted brain scans on them at three time points.

articles.title: Why 2025 Became India’s Breakout Year For Global Data Centres
articles.summary: With global tech giants increasingly zeroing in on India as a key destination for data centre investments, 2025 turned out…

articles.title: How Delhi, Bihar and VP polls reshaped India's political landscape in 2025
articles.summary: Taken together, the Delhi and Bihar verdicts have further weakened Opposition cohesion at the national level. Repeated electoral setbacks have reduced the Congress's leverage within Opposition alliances, while regional parties are increasingly prioritising state-specific strategies over a unified national front.

articles.title: If Cong high command has to decide on leadership, they should do it before Feb: Parameshwara
articles.summary: G Parameshwara says Congress high command must decide on Karnataka leadership before February budget prep. Siddaramaiah aims for 17th Budget amid CM change speculations. Shivakumar also in contention.

articles.title: BMC Elections 2026: BJP gets flak for fielding kin of Maharashtra Speaker Rahul Narwekar
articles.summary: BJP faces criticism for fielding Rahul Narwekar's relatives in BMC elections, despite opposing dynastic politics. Makarand, Harshita, and Gauravi Shivalkar-Narwekar get tickets.

articles.title: D K Shivakumar to become Karnataka CM in early January, claims Congress MLA
articles.summary: Fresh comments by a Congress legislator have reignited speculation over a possible leadership transition in Karnataka, even as Chief Minister Siddaramaiah maintains he will continue in office and party leaders cite an internal agreement brokered by the high command.

articles.title: Congress 140th foundation day: Mallikarjun Kharge says Congress is an ideology and 'ideologies never die'
articles.summary: Congress marks 140th Foundation Day as Mallikarjun Kharge highlights its enduring ideology, historic milestones, and commitment to democracy and unity.

articles.title: Mumbai civic polls: Congress and Vanchit Bahujan Aghadi seal alliance
articles.summary: The tie-up decision was announced by Maharashtra Congress president Harshwardhan Sapkal and VBA state vice-president Dhairyavardhan Pundkar.

articles.title: 140 years of the Indian National Congress: Where is the Grand Old party headed
articles.summary: Founded on December 28, 1885, the Indian National Congress completed 140 years today. The Grand Old Party emerged as the principal movement through which India fought for Independence. Now, with its hoary past behind it, the party stands at a crossroads—searching for political direction even as it remains a potent force in the country’s changing landscape. Where is it headed? Political analyst and writer K.V. Prasad explains.

articles.title: Cybersecurity 2025: Major breaches, data leaks and lessons
articles.summary: The latest worldwide survey reveals that the average cost of a data breach has dropped to around USD 4.44 million, a 9% decrease from the previous year.

articles.title: Tech breakthroughs of 2025: 3D image regeneration, Apple M5 chips, Samsung Galaxy laptops
articles.summary: Chips and hardware are getting faster, more efficient, and way more powerful.

articles.title: Apple Days sale on Vijay Sales: Top deals on iPhone 17 Series, iPhone 16 and MacBook Air (M4)
articles.summary: The retailer is offering MyVS Rewards reward points worth a flat ₹3,000 on purchases of the iPhone 17.

articles.title: Musk's xAI buys third building to expand AI compute power
articles.summary: Elon Musk's xAI buys a third building called MACROHARDRR near Memphis to expand Colossus supercomputer, aiming for 2 gigawatts compute power and 1 million GPUs, sparking environmental concerns.

articles.title: Elon Musk hints X may soon pay creators more than YouTube
articles.summary: Elon Musk has signalled plans to raise creator payouts on X beyond YouTube levels, asking product head Nikita Bier to enforce stricter anti-fraud rules.

articles.title: GTA 6 delayed again to 2027? What fans and insiders say
articles.summary: The latest speculation began with posts on X suggesting Rockstar internally moved GTA 6 into 2027. But, Rockstar Games has not announced any change beyond its current late-2026 window.

articles.title: Meta to acquire Chinese startup Manus to scale autonomous AI agents across its platforms
articles.summary: Meta acquires Chinese AI startup Manus, led by Xiao Hong, to enhance AI agents, integrating its tech while Manus keeps its Singapore base and subscription service.

articles.title: India to lead global 6G race, aims for 10% of worldwide patents: Telecom minister Scindia
articles.summary: The telecom minister said India is working with global partners across continents and multiple technology streams to shape 6G standards, with a clear focus on patent leadership and early influence in global rule-making.

articles.title: UP Police hashtag tops global trending list on X for over two hours; here's why
articles.summary: The hashtag #UP_Police_Manthan trended globally on X after UP Police units shared photos and videos from a two-day conference in Lucknow, officials said.

articles.title: The rise of 'AI Slop': How low-quality AI videos are flooding YouTube feeds worldwide
articles.summary: Kapwing reports up to 33% of YouTube feeds are low-quality AI content. Spain and South Korea top in subscribers and views, sparking global concern.

articles.title: 2025 wasn’t about mutual fund returns — it was about behaviour
articles.summary: India’s mutual fund AUM crossed ₹80 lakh crore in 2025, driven by resilient SIP inflows, rising non-metro participation, and a shift toward disciplined, diversified investing.

articles.title: A look at major credit card updates in 2025 and what lies ahead in 2026
articles.summary: Indian banks like SBI Cards, HDFC, ICICI, and Kotak Mahindra Bank revised credit card fees and benefits in 2025, with AI set to transform credit management for millions in 2026.

articles.title: US says Pakistan is acquiring 36 J-10s from China—as many as Rafale jets bought by India
articles.summary: The main air-to-air weapon of the J-10s are PL-15 missiles, which were used by Pakistan during Operation Sindoor.

articles.title: Not just BSF, MHA working on rules to reserve 50% of all CAPF constable posts for Agniveers
articles.summary: The MHA is deliberating on new recruitment rules for all CAPFs, including the CRPF, ITBP, and SSB. It wants to incorporate a 50% quota for Agniveers across the CAPFs.

articles.title: US clears $686-mn package to breathe fresh life into Pakistani F-16s
articles.summary: Of the total package, $649 million will be utilised for additional hardware, software, and support services, and the remaining for Major Defence Equipment (MDE).

articles.title: Dubai Tejas crash revives focus on advanced, fully automated safety systems
articles.summary: Dubai airshow crash & pilot death have rekindled concerns over pilot safety, and need for smarter automated systems that can step in when G-forces, temporary loss of consciousness hit the pilot.

articles.title: IAF moves for mid-air refuellers, Israel firm in partnership with HAL emerges as the frontrunner
articles.summary: India currently uses six Russian IIyushin-78 tankers, first inducted in 2003, but they are facing maintenance and serviceability issues.

articles.title: India looks to Oman for spare parts to keep its fleet of Jaguars flying
articles.summary: India is now the only country still operating the Jaguar, long retired by its original users, France in 2005 and the UK in 2007, and secondary operators like Oman, Nigeria and Ecuador.

articles.title: Weight-loss drugs are changing. Here’s what to know about GLP-1s
articles.summary: While the drugs have become spectacularly popular, their high prices, along with spotty insurance coverage, have left them out of reach for many. Pills, which will be cheaper, might change that.

articles.title: Should you get screened for breast cancer annually? New study by US scientists suggests better approach
articles.summary: US researchers conducted a trial of over 28,000 women aged 40-74 to find an effective way of distributing breast cancer screening resources. Results published in JAMA on 12 Dec.

articles.title: A Pune startup is transforming radiology screening with AI. How it could fill crucial gap in healthcare
articles.summary: DeepTek’s AI-driven radiology platforms are reshaping chest screening, speeding up diagnoses and increasing their accuracy.

articles.title: From new year, NTA to verify candidates in NEET, JEE & other entrance exams with facial recognition
articles.summary: Aadhaar card will be used for verification. Decision taken after a small trial at some exam centres for NEET-UG this year.

articles.title: Jamia suspends professor over question on ‘atrocities against Muslims in India’ in semester exam paper
articles.summary: New Delhi: Jamia Millia Islamia (JMI) has suspended a professor from its department of social work over a question he set on “atrocities against Muslims in India” in a semester exam paper. According to university officials, there were complaints over a question in the BA (Hons) Social Work first-semester examination held earlier this week in […]

articles.title: UGC tells universities to prevent entry of stray dogs in campus, calls for ’round-the-clock vigil’
articles.summary: Direction is in line with SC's 7 November order asking all states/UTs and Centre to secure educational institutions and other public places from stray canines, says UGC.

articles.title: Parsis to Tibetans, India ‘safe haven’ for ‘persecuted communities’ for centuries—new Class 7 NCERT book
articles.summary: Previous NCERT social science textbooks didn't have such a chapter. No connection to CAA controversy, says NCERT director.

articles.title: Why did Haryana’s brightest fail HPSC’s assistant professor exams? An evaluation or education debate
articles.summary: Angry job aspirants are protesting after only 151 cleared the subject knowledge test for English assistant professor posts in Haryana colleges, when 613 vacancies were up for grabs.

articles.title: There will be respectable alliance of Shiv Sena-BJP for civic body polls: Eknath Shinde
articles.summary: Talking to reporters here, shinde said the alliance talks between the two parties are almost in final stages for the civic body polls in Thane Kalyan Dombivli, Mira Bhayandar and Navi Mumbai civic bodies.
